metadata.description: User name for the Linux Virtual Machines that are part of the Kubernetes cluster and DVM.
SSH public key used for auth to all Linux machines created as part of the the Kubernetes cluster and DVM.
This must be a region-unique name e.g. k8s-12345. Try to chose it same as the resource group name as best practice.
Kubernetes Node Pool Profile Count
The VMSize of Kubernetes node VMs
Kubernetes Master Pool Profile Count
The VMSize of Kubernetes master VMs
The Storage Profile
The Service Principal application ID (used by the Kubernetes Azure cloud provider). More help here: https://github.com/Azure/aks-engine/blob/master/docs/topics/service-principals.md
The Service Principal Client Secret.
The identity system of azure stack. The value could be AzureAD or ADFS
The aks engine scale node count
The kubernetes upgrade version using aks engine
The API Model to be used for kubernetes deployment using aks engine
The Aks Engine Repository to be used for building aks engine binary
The Aks Engine branch to be used for building the aks engine binary
Network plugin which will deployed in Kubernetes cluster
Availability profile that nodes in the Kubernetes cluster will be deployed with
Kubernetes Windows node pool profile count
The virtual machine size of the Kubernetes Windows agent nodes
User name for the Windows virtual machines that are part of the Kubernetes cluster.
Password for the Windows virtual machines that are part of the Kubernetes cluster.
URL path from where Windows binaries will be downloaded.
Name of the Windows package which will be installed.
This is the version for the Kubernetes Azure cloud provider. We would use a custom Kubernetes build specifically for Azure Stack for each version.

osProfile.customData:
[base64(concat('#cloud-config

write_files:
- path: "/opt/azure/containers/script.sh"
  permissions: "0744"
  encoding: gzip
  owner: "root"
  content: !!binary |
    '))]
